minecolonies.config.fixorphanedchunks.co: Automatically fix orphaned chunks which were caused by chunk loading and saving issues. [Default: false]
minecolonies.config.restrictbuilderunder: Si la construction doit être plus lente sous terre ou aussi rapide qu'ailleurs. [Défaut: true]

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.resourcescr: Impossible de trouver un bâtisseur, faites un clic droit en maintenant la touche Maj sur un bâtiment de construction.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: §6 Bienvenue dans Minecolonies. Maintenant que vous avez vos ressources, il serait préférable de rechercher un endroit sympathique pour placer votre hôtel de ville afin de créer votre colonie... loin d'un village, si possible.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: §6 Le mot est bien passé à propos de cette nouvelle colonie. Bientôt, les premiers colons vont rejoindre votre colonie nouvellement créée, si il y a assez d'espace autour de l'hôtel de ville. (Des magistrats expérimentes peuvent éteindre ces messages dans le bloc de l'hôtel de ville.)
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: §6 Les premiers colons sont arrivés. Vous devriez un bâtiment de construction pour commencer votre colonisation.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 Bien joué pour l'emplacement du bâtiment de construction. Cependant, ce n'est pas suffisant. Vous devez y accéder et cliquer sur le bouton pour construire ! Bientôt, votre PNJ va créer des nouveaux bâtiments pour le village.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: §6 Pendant que votre bâtisseur travaille, vous pouvez vérifier les ressources dont il a besoin sur la seconde page de l'interface.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 With the builder's hut completed, we should turn our attention to resource production. I suggest you get a lumberjack or miner. Afterwards get a Tavern to house your citizens
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: §6 Produire des ressources coûte de l'énergie et donne faim à vos colons. Vous voudriez sans doute placer un fermier ou un pêcheur.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: §6 Votre ville commence à prospérer ! Pour améliorer la productivité, vous pourriez améliorer les bâtiments.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 Tous nos colons initiaux sont maintenant au travail. Pour attirer plus de colons, vous devez construire ou améliorer des maisons pour eux.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: §6 I see all your settlers have a nice home now. Build more citizen huts to get more settlers!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 Le dernier citoyen est arrivé dans votre colonie, pour avoir de nouveaux enfants, construisez une cabane de citoyens et assignez-y un homme et une femme.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: §6 Un nouveau colon vient d'arriver, et il apporte la nouvelle que des espions barbares ont trouvé le village prospérant. Vous devriez construire une tour de garde !
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: §6 Une colonie croissante signifie une responsabilité croissante. Vous devriez envisager de placer un restaurant pour bien nourrir vos colons.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: §6 Vos citoyens vous demandent de construire un entrepôt. Ceci allégera votre sac à dos et leur permettra d'obtenir leurs marchandises plus rapidement !
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: §6 Vous avez construit un entrepôt. Cependant vos habitants sont trop occupés pour le remplir. Construisez quelques bâtiment de livraison pour embaucher des livreurs. Ils peuvent travailler jusqu'à cinq par entrepôt.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: §6 Les colons disent que leurs compétences influencent leur rapidité de progression. Vous pouvez employer manuellement des citoyens, si l'option a été activée dans la configuration de l'hôtel de ville. Les meilleures compétences pour le travail demandé seront mises en évidence au cours du processus d'emploi.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: §6 Les travailleurs se plaignent de devoir marcher trop longtemps pour se rendre à leur travail. Vous pouvez les assigner manuellement aux maisons, si l'option est activée dans la configuration de l'hôtel de ville.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: §6 Une colonie en expansion augmente les charges de vos colons. Vous devriez envisager d'améliorer les bâtiments de vos travailleurs.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: §6 Un espion barbare a été capturé à côté de notre colonie, et il semble faire partie d'un groupe plus important. Vous devriez envisager de construire des casernes pour vous défendre.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: §6 Construire plus de maisons que d'emplois disponibles a une mauvaise influence sur le bonheur de vos citoyens.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: §6 Un nouvel enfant est né au sein de votre colonie !
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.childg: %s grew up and wants a job now.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.hireci: §6 Votre offre de recrutement a été acceptée, un nouveau citoyen est arrivé !

advancements.minecolonies.root.title: MineColonies
advancements.minecolonies.root.descripti: Start off MineColonies by crafting a Supply Camp or Ship and placing it via right clicking the item on the ground, this will open up the MineColonies Advancements tab!
advancements.minecolonies.place_townhall: Now's the time to start your colony, Grab that build tool and TownHall block and find a nice clear area, right click with the Build Tool to select the style you want, where you want it, and other nifty things!
advancements.minecolonies.create_build_r: Great, you've started your colony! To start building your colony up you need to craft & place a builder down (Use the build tool again!), hire a builder (Usually Automatic), and then tell them to build their building!
advancements.minecolonies.click_gui_butt: Now that you've told your builder what to do, check out his Requests tab to see what resources or tools he needs and fulfill one of them by clicking that fulfill button!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: Citizens, much like you, Need to eat to be able to work, put some food in your citizen's inventory and they'll eat it when they need to!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: If you're anything like us, you're probably going to get sick of having to craft everything for your workers, right now you can teach your builder 2x2 recipes, go ahead and teach them how to craft a torch!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Building the Builder
Make sure to keep your builder fed, fulfill and requests, and he should start and finish building your first hut!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: So this is what kind of leader you are, feeding your citizens Rotten Flesh? Shame, Shame, Shame!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Build the Lumberjack
Now that you've got that awesome Builder you're going to want to start gathering wood for more huts! Complete building a Lumberjack Hut (Don't forget your build tool for placing!)
Build the Miner
No doubt you're wanting to get some of those tasty ores and some cobble for crafting and building with, Complete building a Mine Hut (Again, don't forget to use your build tool!),
Build Protection
Once you get to 5 citizens in your colony, other entities might take notice of your growing town, make sure to build and hire a Guard to protect against these creatures!
Build a Farm

To get started with some good food production for your citizens, you're going to want to build a Farm for wheat. You'll also want to place down a Field block once you've got your farmer to mark where to farm.
Home Sweet Home
Your citizens need a place to live! Build them a citizen hut, each level facilitates one citizen.
Lone Settlement
Your citizens need a roof over their heads, build a Tavern for some initial housing and recruitment.
The Centrepiece

Once you've got your town setup nicely with a good flow of resources you might want to think about building your Town Hall, there are only a couple benefits of this currently, but it's a cool centre piece!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: You're going to need to get more citizens if you want to get things done! Children will be born when two citizens of opposite gender are in the same house during the night, children need to be fed and sleep well to grow up!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Conteneur
I'm sure at this point you're wanting to start automating stuff right? Well first we've got to place and build a Warehouse to store all those goodies we're getting in a central location!
Requesting Items,
Now that we've got a good central storage location, lets start automatically answering citizen requests! Build a Delivery Man's hut to have them respond to Worker's requests.
Crafting Wood!,
With the Delivery Person by your side, you can now start using crafting workers! We recommend starting off with the sawmill, place and build one to start your new crafting experience!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting with your sawmill, teach them how to craft a door! Note: Crafters will only craft on requests, and have a limit on what they can craft, see their info tab in their hut for more.
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Such a Stoner
A Stonemason can craft 3x3 recipes using Stone as their main ingredient, build one to take advantage of their skill!
Smelt that ore!
Smeltery workers are pretty awesome, they'll smelt your ores for you! And, at higher levels they can get pretty efficient....
It's getting Hot in here
In order for your stonemason to make stone bricks and things like that you're going to need some Stone, place and build a Stone Smeltery to automate the creation of that resource and more!
Get Baked
Your citizens need some carbs in their lives, build a baker to automatically create bread for them!
Good ol' Smithy
Most citizens need some form of tool, and crafting those can be a very specialised process, Build the Blacksmith to allow the creation of those tools!
Building an Army
If you really want to protect your colony, you're going to need a whole lot more guards, building a barracks will allow you to hire a lot more in a much smaller space!
Beautiful Towers
Now you've got your barracks, you need to build the Barracks Towers inside it, these towers are locked to the same level as the barracks and will increase their max guards every level!
A Poultry Sum of Meat
Chickens may be noisy, but they're also tasty! Build a Chicken Herder to bring in those sweet chicken legs. Don't forget to gather up some chickens in their stable!
Taking Knight classes

If you want to truly protect your citizens you're going to need well trained knights, build a Combat Academy and assign a citizen to it to increase his guard levels without the risk of losing their life!
Fertile Lands
A composter will take your left over saplings, leaves, and like items and expose them to the elements, doing this will produce fertilizer for your crops!
Feeding the Masses
Building a restaurant will give your citizens a place to go to get food, the cook will cook any meats needed and give food items to your citizens, and even you!
Yeeeeaah !
Build a cowboy to bring in that tasty tasty beef, remember you'll need to bring the cows to your Cowboy for them to be usable.
I'm crushed
Building a crusher will enable you to get things like Gravel from cobblestone!
Something smells Fishy
Build a fisherman close to water to bring in those deep sea morsels
Higher Learning
If you want more skilled labour you'd best build a Library to teach your citizens!
Mary had a little Lamb
Sometimes you really need some soft wool in your life, Build a Shepherd to take advantage of those poor unsuspecting sheep!
Diamond in the Rough
Sometimes you'll find goodies inside those crappy other blocks, Build a sifter to see if you can take advantage of that!
Getting the Bacon
Nobody can resist bacon, build a Swine Herder so that your citizens don't miss out!
Level Up!
In order to upgrade other huts beyond level 1, you'll need to have a builder that's been upgraded!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: 10 Citizens means more workers, and more workers means more resources!
25 Citizens is a lot, I hope you're keeping them alive!
50 Citizens is enough to have almost 2 of every worker, Wow!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Double Trouble!
A level 3 Smeltery has a 100% chance of doubling ore output, nice!
Ore Tripling
A level 5 Smeltery has a chance of tripling every ore output, the chance is equal to the Worker's Level!
A Building to be Proud Of
While there's not a lot of benefit to having a level 5 Town hall it sure does look pretty!
Bull's Eye
While Knights are pretty great, they're even better when they've got backup in the form of archers, better train some of those as well!
Floral Arrangements
The floral hut will use compost, or other types of "bonemeal" to grow you all those pesky flowers your buildings tend to want!
Enchanting Experience
The enchanter hut will consume Ancient tomes and Other workers experience to produce enchanted books for your personal usage!

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
The Builder is the heart of your colony. Without them, you wouldn't be able to get anything done!
 Every hut worker has to have their building built to at least level 1 before they can do anything, except the Builder. If the Builder has a hut at level 0 (no hut), they can only build one thing, their own hut.

 For your Builder to build, upgrade, reposition, or repair a hut that isn't their own, their hut must be at least the same level as the other hut. For example, the Builder's Hut must be level 3 or above to build a level 3 hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Let's cover builder restrictions:

 1. Builders (and most other workers) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Builders have a maximum range of 100 blocks for buildings for automatic assignment. If your building is outside that range, in the top right of the build options GUI (for the hut you want to be built) you can select which Builder to assign to that building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?
   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request Dirt and then use a shovel on it).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 With higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The Citizen Hut is where your citizens will live. For every level of the Citizen Hut the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a Citizen Hut are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one Citizen Hut. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any hut within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their Citizen Hut. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need an pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the miners request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, the Miner levels up while working.
 With higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The lumberjack is one of the production workers for your colony. Give him an axe and he'll cut down any trees around him, he'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees he can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page, here you can tell the lumberjack to not replant saplings, or you can tell him to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Lumberjacks unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Lumberjacks are able to search for trees within a 150 blocks of their worker (not the hut), while searching they start with a 50 block search range and then increase that range by 5 when they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best, we've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally we define a tree as a log and leaves (within a near vicinity), due to this some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the lumberjack, to counter this you can place a piece of Cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers the lumberjack levels up while chopping trees.
 Similar to the builder, with higher levels their speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The warehouse is part of colony management. Where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the warehouse, but the deliverymen use the warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic, you can not add your own, if you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the deliverymen will not see those racks or use them. You can not move the racks in the building, if you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the deliverymen.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space then is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building, if the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by upgrading on page 2 using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the builder. If you must move the warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any deliverymen don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: The delivermen are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony, they will pick up unneeded items from workers huts and drop them at the warehouse, or gathering needed items from the warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The amount of items the deliveryman can carry depends on his hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the deliverymen pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a Pickup priority setting, it can be set to automatic (auto set), manual (you change the setting at the bottom 1 is lowest, 10 is highest, or never (no items will ever be picked up.

 Q 2. Can I can the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent.

As all workers the deliveryman levels up while delivering and picking up items.
 With higher levels the deliverymen's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.

The cook is part of the food production line of your colony. The cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes. (Or other cooked food that only needs a furnace.)
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1: The cook can not make any food with items that are not consumed in the making such as pots and pans (these are usually from other mods such as Pam's).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-made items to the cook for them to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.3:

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The farmer is part of the food production line of your colony. The farmer grows the food for the colony. The farmer can plant and harvest any food item that is planted in farm land soil, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:

   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers can not grow plants that do not use farm land, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. 
 Farmers can only mantain one field per hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:

The fisherman is part of the food production line of your colony. Simply put, the fisherman will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing pole.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The fisherman needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at ground level with the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My fisherman is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The fishermen can catch other items from the water, same as the player.

As all workers the fisherman levels up while working.
 With higher levels the fisherman's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The chickenherder is part of the food production line. The chickenherder breeds, raises, and butchers chickens for your colony. They will also collect eggs and feathers. The chickenherder can have two chickens per level of the hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chickenherders (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided to the chickenherder for them to start breeding and butchering them.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my chickenherder need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The herder also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers the chickenherder levels up while working.
 With higher levels the chickenherder's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.

The composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The composter will take items that you choose for them to use, to make compost for your farmer and florist to use.

Now let's cover composter restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, these must be added in the configuration file for Minecolonies found in your game's config file ../config/minecolonies-common.toml

As all workers the composter levels up while working.
 With higher levels the composter's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower: The guard tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each guard tower houses one guard. However, the guard will also live here so it frees up a bed in the citizen huts for more citizens.

Now let's cover guard tower restrictions:

 1. Guards (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

2. The guards will only patrol a certain area depending on their hut level: 
   lvl 1. 80 Blocks
   lvl 2. 110 Blocks
   lvl 3. 140 Blocks
   lvl 4. 170 Blocks 
   lvl 5. 200 Blocks
   However, they will stay inside the colony border.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My guards towers have been leveled up but the guards aren't asking for higher level equipment, why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers the guards levels up while working.
 With higher levels the guards speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up.

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The barracks is the heart of your military defense, without it you wouldn't be able to build any barracks towers.
 Each barracks contain four barracks towers, one for each level up to level four.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover barracks restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the barracks. So if you have a level one barracks, it will only allow for one barracks tower and it's max level is one. If you have a level three barracks, it will allow for three barracks towers and their max level is three.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than one barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the tower levels are based on the barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one barracks that is level 5, if the second barracks is only level one, then that barracks can only have a single level one tower.
